Black-skinned-fruit, baking-spice and leather aromas slowly take shape. The ripe palate offers blackberry jam, clove and black pepper alongside chewy tannins. Drink after 2022. KERIN O’KEEFE
Made entirely with Malbec, this has aromas suggesting violet, leather and graphite. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, cocoa and vanilla alongside velvety tannins. KERIN O’KEEFE

Made with organically farmed Cabernet Franc, this has aromas of bell pepper, bay leaf and dark berry. The savory palate offers black plum, mocha and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2022. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas evoking cocoa, violet, toast and baked plum slowly take shape in the glass. While the name translates to “Little Masseto,” this ripe brawny wine is anything but little, evoking roasted coffee bean, ground clove, coconut and dried cherry set against assertive, close-grained tannins. It reflects the extreme heat of the vintage, with scorching alcohol that dominates the clenching finish and throws it off balance. Give the tannins a few years to unwind. KERIN O’KEEFE

Ripe dark-skinned-fruit, scorched earth and mocha aromas appear in the glass. The firm palate offers black-plum jam, star anise and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023. KERIN O’KEEFE

This opens with aromas evoking scorched earth, toasted nut and underbrush. On the round, juicy palate, polished tannins accompany fleshy Morello cherry, licorice and clove. Drink through 2021. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Tenuta Buon Tempo 2017 Rosso di Montalcino

column1: Aromas of French oak, mature plum, coconut and camphor lead the nose. On the dense, easygoing palate, licorice and espresso notes accent black cherry. It's already accessible, with buffed tannins. Drink through 2022. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Banfi 2018 Poggio alle Mura (Rosso di Montalcino)

column1: Made with 45% Sangiovese, 45% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Petit Verdot, this has aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers black currant, nutmeg and vanilla alongside solid tannins. Enjoy soon. KERIN O’KEEFE
